chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew Allen Utzig was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Threat to Law Enforcement Officer, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.203(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Complete AODA and all treatment/counseling as necessary.

Absolute sobriety 
Not to consume or possess a controlled substance without a valid prescription and in prescribed amounts only.

records.addlTxt: 2:31 PM Defendant Matthew Allen Utzig in court.  Attorney Kevin M Smith in court for Matthew Allen Utzig.  Attorney Noah M Tylenda in court for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads guilty to count 4. Court finds defendant guilty. Defendant waives his right to a presentence investigation. Court orders 2 years probation, costs due within 60 days, AODA, any other treatment deemed necessary, absolute sobriety and not to consume or possess a controlled substance without a valid prescription and in prescribed amounts only. Sentence credit 4 days. Counts 1, 2, 3 and 5 dismissed and read in.

03:12 PM Defendant Matthew Allen Utzig in court by video means, in custody at the Rock County Jail and with attorney Kevin M Smith by video means and with intern Olivia Long by video means.  Noah M Tylenda appeared for the State of Wisconsin by video means.   Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Signature bond of $2000 set, no contact directly or indirectly with TT and AT, vehicle, residence, place of employment or elsewhere, absolute sobriety, no intentional contact with Officers Gille, Limberg or Kelly, curfew of 6 pm and 6 am unless at work or traveling to or from work, Court orders Level 4 supervision through JusticePoint.  Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
